66865ee0-4159-489e-8e86-f08d0ba7a8b4.description: Learners will create an actionable business plan and prototype using human centered design principles and pitch their business concepts to an audience.
66865ee0-4159-489e-8e86-f08d0ba7a8b4.name: Business by Design (v.1)

alignments.name: College and Career Readiness Standards (MN)
alignments.description: Employability Skills: Communication Academic Content Knowledge Collaboration Creativity Critical Thinking. Mindsets and Social Awareness Growth Mindset Cultural Fluency & Global Awareness Self-Advocacy & Management Decision Making Problem Solving Technology & Information Literacy. Career Development: Career Awareness & Exploration.

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include presentations, performance rubrics/checklists, Business Model Canvas and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.

Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, discussion, computer-based training, project-based instruction, coaching/mentoring, practical exercises, learner presentations, work-based learning, games/competition.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

0ad4bbaf-7dcd-48d1-a8e9-e2cbc87b4e7e.description: A Rêver in Residence will create an individualized project plan with defined deliverables to further the development of the business concept they designed in Reve's Business by Design course. The plan is focused on 3 topics: Desirability, Viability, and Feasibility of the business concept. Residents will present their project work in a pitch presentation based on the 3 topics of residency pitch rubrics.
0ad4bbaf-7dcd-48d1-a8e9-e2cbc87b4e7e.name: Rever in Residence (v.1)

alignments.name: College and Career Readiness Standards (MN)
alignments.description: Employability Skills: Communication Academic Content Knowledge Creativity Technology & Information Literacy. Mindsets and Social Awareness: Growth Mindset Self-Advocacy & Management. Transitional Knowledge: Career Field and Postsecondary Entrance Requirements. Career Development: Career Awareness, Exploration, and Preparation.

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include presentations, performance rubrics/checklists, with a minimum passing score of 80%.

Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, discussion, project-based instruction, coaching/mentoring, practical exercises, learner presentations, classroom exercise, work-based learning.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.
